file_content.text: So--the Jedi finally arrives. Started to think you'd gotten cold feet.
About time, Major. Was beginning to think you Havoc Squad hotshots were all talk.
Nice of you to finally show up, Captain. Hope you're ready to get your hands dirty.
You made it--took you long enough. Let's get to it, shall we?
I'm Warden Playt. This here's my second-in-command, Graal.
Now, let's get one thing straight: This is my prison. You want to help out, bust a few heads, fine; but you'll do things my way, understand?
I'm not here to challenge your authority, warden.
Don't worry.
Save your hostility for the enemy.
Settle down.
Sorry. I've got a riot to put down, and I don't have time for social niceties.
I'm no stranger to following orders, warden.
No problem.
This is your party, and you don't want anyone crashing it. Got it.
Whatever you say.
Good. Last thing I need is some loose cannon jeopardizing our operation.
Just tell me what's happening.
You haven't heard? Got ourselves a planet-wide stampede on our hands.
I do things one way--mine.
I don't answer to you.
You just watch yourself. Endanger my men and I'll punt your sorry butt right off this rock.
This facility houses some of the galaxy's most dangerous criminals. Was one of the Republic's best-kept secrets until the Empire caught on.
Our guards found a sub-space transmitter in one of the prison wards; crude, but functional. Must've taken decades to scrap together.
Blasted thing led the Imperials right to us. They snuck in, sprang the prisoners and blew open the armories in a single strike.
You're telling me the prisoners are all free... and armed?
That's not good.
That's the short of it.
I need to know who--or what--we're dealing with here.
Tell me about the prisoners.
Only the worst of the worst find themselves in my prison. Use your imagination.
What were your guards doing while all this was going on? Sleeping?
That's what security is for.
My men are used to corralling inmates and breaking kneecaps. They're not trained to fight off Imperial troopers.
Military's already sent a few "elite" detachments our way. Been about as useful as a tauntaun in a sandstorm.
Last we heard, they'd lost the Deep Prison. Encountered some unknown species in the maximum security wing; they're getting pummeled.
Let 'em sweat. Our priority is securing this level, and that means stamping out a gang of lunatics calling themselves the Condemned.
They're all second and third-generation prisoners--born and raised right here in the prison. Just as twisted as the scum they're descended from.
Sounds like they got a pretty raw deal.
They were born here? Ouch.
Save your sympathy. They're animals, every last one.
Any chance of negotiating with them?
Can they be reasoned with?
I'd sooner shave a Gamorrean's backside than cater to their demands.
Must be a rough bunch.
Oh, they've been downright neighborly.
Thanks to them, our security fields are down and our access to the armories has been cut off. We're sitting naked here.
If we can retake the armories and get those fields back online, we'll be in business. Then we'll--wait, what's that?
Warden! Return fire!
